text.__SUMMARY__:
Mycena lux-coeli—meaning "heavenly light mushrooms"—is a bioluminescent species of fungus in the Mycenaceae family. It was first discovered in 1954 on Hachijō-jima where it is widely found, and decades later was found on multiple islands in Japan.Hachijō-jima island is also home to the bioluminescent mushroom species, Mycena chlorophos. The local name for these mushrooms is hato-no-hi, literally "pigeon fire".
